body:
No, not to any of theses, and IIRC, depending on how/when you call it the
number of stacklevel may differ.

On Dec 21, 2016 11:43, "Thomas Kluyver" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@takluyver* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In IPython/core/interactiveshell.py
> <https://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/10100#pullrequestreview-14035517>
> :
>
> > @@ -354,9 +354,8 @@ def _exiter_default(self):
>      @observe('prompt_in1', 'prompt_in2', 'prompt_out', 'prompt_pad_left')
>      def _prompt_trait_changed(self, change):
>          name = change['name']
> -        warn("InteractiveShell.{name} is deprecated since IPython 4.0 and ignored since 5.0, set TerminalInteractiveShell.prompts object directly.".format(
> -                name=name)
> -        )
> +        warn("InteractiveShell.{name} is deprecated since IPython 4.0 and ignored since 5.0, set TerminalInteractiveShell.prompts object directly.".format(name=name), stacklevel=2)
>
> I suspect that stacklevel=2 is insufficient for traitlet changed methods,
> because there's likely to be several more Python layers between them and
> the user. @Carreau <https://github.com/Carreau>, have you fixed warnings
> on any of these?
>
> â€”
